body:
Because it involves copying data to Pandas, just printing a high-cardinality CategoricalIndex can take a very long time:

```python
dt = pd.CategoricalIndex(range(100_000_000))
print(dt)  # almost instantaneous

dt = cudf.CategoricalIndex(range(100_000_000))
print(dt)  # can take several seconds
```

We should figure out if we can do this by copying only the minimum amount of data to Pandas (or not copying to Pandas at all).
title: [BUG] `__repr__` for a high cardinality categorical can take a very long time
